revised_title: John Lewis Guillemard: A Biographical Sketch
tldr: This article provides a biographical overview of John Lewis Guillemard, a member of the Huguenot refugee family, who was born in 1764 and died in 1844. Guillemard was a well-educated man, having studied at St. John's College, Oxford. He was also involved in international affairs, serving as a commissioner on behalf of England to adjudicate claims under the Treaty of Amity with America. Guillemard was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1806 and contributed to the founding of a fund to promote experimental research. He passed away in November 1844 and was buried in Dagenham, Essex.
